description: President Joe Biden on Monday signed legislation banning the import of Russian enriched uranium, starting a 90-day countdown until limits on shipments of the reactor fuel take effect.
title: Biden Signs Ban on Imports of Russian Nuclear Reactor Fuel

description: The UK and Saudi Arabia will host a joint summit in Riyadh on Tuesday, aimed at boosting economic ties between the two countries as negotiations continue over a broader trade deal between Britain and the Gulf states.
title: UK Seeks Stronger Saudi Ties With 450-Strong Business Delegation

description: On today’s Big Take podcast, our exclusive interview with Emmanuel Macron. Plus, Bloomberg editor-in-chief John Micklethwait on the parallels between Macron and Obama.
title: France’s Economic Revolution: An Interview with Emmanuel Macron

description: Wall Street investors are looking for indicators that Donald Trump could beat President Joe Biden in November as they weigh investment decisions, Key Square Group LP founder Scott Bessent said.
title: Wall Street Titans Are Looking for Signs Trump Can Win, Bessent Says

description: The board of struggling state-owned oil company Petroleos del Peru SA is pushing the government to sell a majority stake in the company to the private sector as losses continue to mount.
title: Board of Ailing Oil Firm Petroperu Pushes Government to Privatize

description: Labour’s David Lammy and John Healey promised to maintain the UK’s “ironclad” commitment to supporting Ukraine in its war against Russia if the opposition party wins a looming general election, as the two senior members of the shadow cabinet visited Kyiv.
title: Labour’s Lammy Vows ‘Ironclad’ Support for Ukraine on Kyiv Visit

description: As President Joe Biden prepares a new wave of tariffs against China, a US soybean trade group is pushing for higher levies on Chinese used cooking oil that it says is undercutting American crops used for biofuels.
title: Flood of Chinese Used Cooking Oil Spurs Call to Boost US Tariffs

description: Michael Cohen directly connected Donald Trump to the hush-money payment to adult-film actress Stormy Daniels to keep their alleged sexual encounter out of the news ahead of the 2016 election.
title: Michael Cohen Testimony Ties Trump to Hush Money Payment

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, deputy White House editor Justin Sink previews the next Biden administration moves on tariffs. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Aims to Show Voters He’s as Tough on China as Trump

description: The European Union temporarily lifted sanctions against the head of Venezuela’s election authority and three former officials, an overture designed to encourage a free and fair presidential vote in July.
title: EU Suspends Sanctions on Venezuela Official Ahead of Election

description: Le président français, qui plaide en faveur d'une transformation du modèle économique du continent, se dit ouvert au rachat d’une grande banque nationale par un rival européen.
title: Macron plaide pour la transformation du modèle économique européen

description: Using Facebook in the lead-up to the US 2020 presidential election might have increased the chances of someone voting for Donald Trump, university researchers said in a study published Monday in the academic journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.
title: Facebook Use May Have Helped Trump With Some Voters, Report Says

description: South Africa’s Cyril Ramaphosa will sign-off on a controversial health insurance bill Wednesday, two weeks before national elections.
title: South African President to Sign Contentious Health Plan Into Law

description: Top officials from Saudi Arabia’s mega projects gathered in Riyadh to share progress updates and seek partners to help deliver a key pillar of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s plan to transform the economy.
title: Saudi Mega Projects Seek Partners in Bid to Hit Economic Goals

description: Andrey Belousov, Russia’s new defense minister, has three great passions — art, the state and President Vladimir Putin.
title: New Russian Defense Minister Is Devoted to Putin and State Power

description: Senator Tim Scott is slated to appear at a political event featuring some of the biggest names in finance, including Citadel’s Ken Griffin, Apollo’s Marc Rowan and Pershing Square’s Bill Ackman, as the South Carolina Republican vies to be Donald Trump’s running mate.
title: Ken Griffin, Bill Ackman to Appear With Potential Trump VP Tim Scott

description: Following is a transcript of French President Emmanuel Macron’s interview with Bloomberg Editor-in-Chief John Micklethwait.
title: Read the Full Transcript of Bloomberg’s Interview With Emmanuel Macron

description: The French President signals he’d be open to cross-border bank M&A as he sets out the case for a transformative shift in the continent’s economic model
title: Macron Puts French Banks in Play With Plan to Transform Europe

description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan underscored his support for Hamas, saying more than a thousand members of the organization are being treated in Turkey.
title: Erdogan Says More Than 1,000 Hamas Members Treated in Turkey

description: Rishi Sunak’s government said it will appeal a Northern Ireland court ruling that found key parts of the UK’s immigration policy cannot apply in the region because they contravene Brexit rules agreed with the European Union.
title: Sunak to Appeal N. Ireland Court Ruling on His Migration Policy

description: Ukrainian Finance Minister Serhiy Marchenko will be part of the talks among Group of Seven finance chiefs and central bankers congregating in Stresa next week, according to host-nation Italy.
title: Ukraine Finance Chief to Participate in Stresa G-7, Italy Says

description: The European Investment Bank will help the region develop its defense industry by financing a wider array of dual-use projects, President Nadia Calvino said.
title: EIB Ready Step Up Support for Defense Industry, Calvino Says

description: Tunisian activists accused authorities of carrying out the country’s worst-ever crackdown on dissent in recent days, as lawyers and journalists were targeted in a wave of arrests ahead of a presidential vote later this year.
title: Tunisia NGOs Say Worst-Ever Crackdown Targets Lawyers, Reporters

description: German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser denounced the apparent desecration of the grave of Wolfgang Schaeuble as a “disgusting crime” and called for the perpetrators to be punished.
title: German Minister Calls Schaeuble Grave Desecration ‘Disgusting’

description: David Solomon said he’s encouraged by French leaders’ efforts to make the country more friendly to business as Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has tripled its Paris headcount in recent years.
title: Goldman’s Solomon Sees France Making More Pro-Business Strides

description: A committee of Kenyan lawmakers rejected a bid to dismiss Agriculture Secretary Mithika Linturi, saying there was no proof for allegations that he participated in a scheme to distribute sub-standard fertilizer under a subsidy program.
title: Kenya Lawmakers Reject Bid to Dismiss Agriculture Minister

description: US Representative Andy Kim isn’t done taking on New Jersey’s political machine.
title: NJ Transit Is Congressman Andy Kim’s Next Quarrel With His Own Party

description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said she hopes China won’t mount major retaliation against any steps Washington takes to safeguard its investments in critical new industries.
title: Yellen Hopes China Doesn’t Mount ‘Significant’ Trade Retaliation

description: The four parties in talks to form the next Dutch government have agreed to cancel a 15% tax on share buybacks, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Dutch Coalition Parties Agree to Scrap 15% Tax on Share Buybacks

description: A smaller group of European Union members may need to go it alone on breaking down capital-market barriers should a bloc-wide solution remain elusive, according to EU economy chief Paolo Gentiloni.
title: Smaller CMU Deal Possible If Broad Pact Stalls, Gentiloni Says

description: McGill University, one of Canada’s most prestigious schools, will go to court Monday seeking an injunction to shut down a pro-Palestinian student encampment that has been growing on its Montreal campus.
title: Canada’s McGill University Seeks Court Order to Shut Down Protest Camp

description: Donald Trump and Michael Cohen Source: Bloomberg
title: Updates From Trump Hush-Money Criminal Trial

description: Estonian battery developer Skeleton Technologies is expanding in France as part of a wider strategy to be ready to sell shares on the stock exchange in three years, according to Chief Executive Officer and co-founder Taavi Madiberk.
title: Estonian Battery Maker Skeleton Aims to Be Ready for IPO in 2027

description: The Kremlin opened up the fiscal taps after President Vladimir Putin’s reelection in March, putting the budget back into deep deficit despite a surge in oil revenues.
title: Russia’s Post-Election Spending Sends Budget Into Deep Deficit

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Doubling Down on Danger: Can Sunak Win Back Voters With Security Pitch?

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Modi’s BJP Has Strong Hold in India’s Kanpur Struggling With Pollution and Poor Infra

description: The European Union said Monday that it will close probes into bids by Chinese firms for a Romanian solar park because the companies are pulling out of the tender.
title: EU to Close China Solar Probe as Companies Withdraw Romania Bids

description: Germany’s domestic intelligence agency can continue to monitor the far-right Alternative for Germany as a suspected case of extremism that represents a potential threat to democracy, according to a ruling Monday.
title: Germany Can Monitor AfD as Threat to Democracy, Court Rules

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Macron’s Drive for a Strong EU Faces Hurdles

description: Unexplained outflows of capital from Turkey surged again during a month when voters went to the polls, a repeat of the money drain it suffered in the run-up to national elections a year ago.
title: Turkey’s Mystery Outflows Hit Near $10 Billion in Election Month

description: The bribery trial of Senator Robert Menendez begins Monday with the embattled New Jersey Democrat potentially blaming his wife for his predicament and seeking to call a psychiatrist to defend why he hoarded the $480,000 in cash and 13 gold bars FBI agents found in his house.
title: Bob Menendez Bribe Trial Over Gold Bars, Cash Begins in New York

description: US officials intend to highlight security concerns with China’s development of artificial intelligence when they meet representatives from that country to launch discussions over the emerging technology, according to senior administration officials.
title: US to Raise Concerns Over China’s AI Development in Geneva Talks

description: Ukraine is deploying more troops to stabilize its northeastern frontline after Russia launched a large-scale offensive against the Kharkiv region for the first time since 2022.
title: Ukraine Sends Forces to Halt Russia’s Advance in Kharkiv Region

description: Nadhim Zahawi, former chancellor of the Exchequer, has been named chairman of Very Group, just days after announcing he will stand down as a UK Member of Parliament at the next general election.
title: Tory MP Zahawi Appointed Chairman of Retailer Very Group

description: The Philippines’ Department of Foreign Affairs said it will “look into any reports of illegal and unlawful activities” by foreign diplomats, following China’s threat to release a recording of a purported call on a supposed South China Sea deal.
title: Philippines to Probe Foreign Diplomats’ Acts After China Threat

description: The UK charged three men with assisting Hong Kong’s foreign intelligence service, following an investigation by the Metropolitan Police’s counter terrorism force.
title: UK Charges Three Over Hong Kong Related Security Offences

description: President Vladimir Putin’s surprise late-night shuffle of his defense and security team signals his determination to mobilize Russia’s war economy for a long and intensified conflict in Ukraine against the West.
title: Putin Turns to a Technocrat to Crank Up Russia’s War Machine

description: Senior South Korean and Chinese diplomats are set to hold their first talks in Beijing in some six years, with US policies on semiconductor exports and North Korea’s atomic ambitions likely to dominate the encounter.
title: Top China, South Korea Diplomats Set for Rare Talks in Beijing

description: Bernie Sanders urged Denmark to force its most valuable company, Novo Nordisk A/S, to lower its drug prices, in a letter submitted by the US senator to one of the Nordic country’s largest newspapers.
title: Sanders Urges Denmark to Pressure Novo Nordisk on Lowering Drug Prices

description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis will meet Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in Ankara on Monday as the neighbors on NATO’s southeastern flank focus on improving long-strained relations.
title: Turkey and Greece Aim to Better Ties Even as Cyprus Tensions Linger

description: For the first time since White-minority rule ended three decades ago, South Africa is heading into national elections in which an outright winner isn’t apparent. A series of opinion polls show the ruling African National Congress risks losing its majority in the May 29 vote and may have to enlist the support of one or more rivals to continue governing Africa’s most industrialized economy.
title: Who’s Who in South Africa’s Tightest Post-Apartheid Election

description: Indonesia’s President-elect Prabowo Subianto said his incoming administration will maintain an open foreign policy approach and not be drawn into choosing sides between the US and China as they compete for influence.
title: Indonesia Won’t Take Sides in US-China Row, Prabowo Tells TV

description: More than a hundred Philippine civilians are set to sail to the South China Sea this week, risking a faceoff with dozens of Chinese vessels reportedly deployed near a shoal that’s been the site of recent clashes.
title: Philippine Civilians Risk China Faceoff in Sail to Disputed Sea

description: Elon Musk and his social media website X Corp. were granted a reprieve in their fight against the Australian government after the presiding judge refused to extend an order mandating the removal of footage from a stabbing attack in Sydney.
title: Musk’s X Wins Court Reprieve in Fight With Australian Government
